Dublin Core:Title: Flood Hazard Zones: Stark County, Ohio, United States
Dublin Core:Description: Flood hazard areas from the Flood Insurance Rate Map (FIRM) within Stark County, Ohio. Flood hazard areas are sometimes referred to as flood hazard zones or flood plains. They depict the floodway (area that is frequently flooded), as well as the 100 and 500-year flood plains. The data was downloaded in September, 2019, from https://msc.fema.gov/portal/advanceSearch?and clipped to the county boundary.The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) produces Flood Insurance Rate maps and identifies Special Flood Hazard Areas as part of the National Flood Insurance Program's floodplain management. Special Flood Hazard Areas have regulations that include the mandatory purchase of flood insurance.Dataset SummaryPhenomenon Mapped: Flood Hazard Areas Mosaic Projection: Web Mercator Auxiliary SphereExtent: Stark County, Ohio Source: Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) Publication Date: September 14, 2018
